result.values:
{"Critical Update Instruction Flow./start.message":{"@class":"InVal","@id":"5554121b-83c1-460f-839e-ebe11a426d37","value":"

After reviewing all documentation, run a scan to find password2 fields that 3DES ciphertext in your instance.

  • Navigate to All > Instance Scan > Suites.
  • In the Suites list, select Password2 Fields Security Assessment
  • In the Suites record, select Triple DES Usages in Password2 Fields from the Checks related list.
    • The Script Type Check displays. This record contains a description of the check, and information on links how to update the records found by the check.
  • In the Column Type Check record, select Test Check to run the scan.
    • During the scan execution a Execute Test Scan, a window displays the progress of the scan.
  • When the scan is complete, select Go to Result to view the Scan Result record.
    • In the Scan Result record, the Scan Findings list displays a list of impacted password2 fields.
  • Select the Count field on the Scan Findings list to navigate to a record.
  • Review all Scan Findings and evaluate against the considerations before upgrading.
","displayValue":"

After reviewing all documentation, run a scan to find password2 fields that 3DES ciphertext in your instance.

  • Navigate to All > Instance Scan > Suites.
  • In the Suites list, select Password2 Fields Security Assessment
  • In the Suites record, select Triple DES Usages in Password2 Fields from the Checks related list.
    • The Script Type Check displays. This record contains a description of the check, and information on links how to update the records found by the check.
  • In the Column Type Check record, select Test Check to run the scan.
    • During the scan execution a Execute Test Scan, a window displays the progress of the scan.
  • When the scan is complete, select Go to Result to view the Scan Result record.
    • In the Scan Result record, the Scan Findings list displays a list of impacted password2 fields.
  • Select the Count field on the Scan Findings list to navigate to a record.
  • Review all Scan Findings and evaluate against the considerations before upgrading.
","template":"","hasValue":true,"inputUsed":false,"simpleType":"OPAQUE","valTemplate":null,"errorMessage":null,"references":[]},"Critical Update Instruction Flow.4d584e80-3d15-45fe-b99e-e8e00a4bf6eb./end.record":{"@class":"InVal","@id":"13b56b10-005c-4988-86df-9cd89ce5c0fd","value":{"@class":"com.snc.process_flow.engine.serialization.GRProxy","table":"sys_flow_data","sys_id":["a809848004866210559073c06a02f794"],"row":0,"sort":null,"desc":false},"displayValue":"a809848004866210559073c06a02f794","template":"","hasValue":true,"inputUsed":false,"simpleType":"OPAQUE","valTemplate":null,"errorMessage":null,"references":[]}}

{"Critical Update Instruction Flow./start.message":{"@class":"InVal","@id":"7bd4bd7f-1789-4c84-82e4-20953ed23c7a","value":"
  1. For users not logging in through the UI:
    • Select these users on the Integration Users page.
    • Click 'Enable Web Service'
    • This action enables the 'Web Service Access Only' flag for these users in the sys_user table and removes them from the list.
  2. For users logging in through the UI:
    • Create a new user account dedicated to the integration.
    • Replace the existing user account with the new one in the integration settings.
","displayValue":"
  1. For users not logging in through the UI:
    • Select these users on the Integration Users page.
    • Click 'Enable Web Service'
    • This action enables the 'Web Service Access Only' flag for these users in the sys_user table and removes them from the list.
  2. For users logging in through the UI:
    • Create a new user account dedicated to the integration.
    • Replace the existing user account with the new one in the integration settings.

result.values:
{"Critical Update Instruction Flow./start.message":{"@class":"InVal","@id":"9d1ac23b-6209-49f3-8a60-2e9667f278b1","value":"
  • Ensure the functionality depending on the modified records continue to work and have no regressions.
  • Re-run the same ATF Test Suites from earlier step, to ensure all tests are still passing after the fixes.
  • Ensure the legacy encrypted values are migrated for the alternative products/apis chosen in the remediation or legacy encrypted values are decryptable by the remediation.
","displayValue":"
  • Ensure the functionality depending on the modified records continue to work and have no regressions.
  • Re-run the same ATF Test Suites from earlier step, to ensure all tests are still passing after the fixes.
  • Ensure the legacy encrypted values are migrated for the alternative products/apis chosen in the remediation or legacy encrypted values are decryptable by the remediation.
","template":"","hasValue":true,"inputUsed":false,"simpleType":"OPAQUE","valTemplate":null,"errorMessage":null,"references":[]},"Critical Update Instruction Flow.4d584e80-3d15-45fe-b99e-e8e00a4bf6eb./end.record":{"@class":"InVal","@id":"2d43a559-899b-4a7c-98a2-ee027adc8b89","value":{"@class":"com.snc.process_flow.engine.serialization.GRProxy","table":"sys_flow_data","sys_id":["0d09c48004866210559073c06a02f7be"],"row":0,"sort":null,"desc":false},"displayValue":"0d09c48004866210559073c06a02f7be","template":"","hasValue":true,"inputUsed":false,"simpleType":"OPAQUE","valTemplate":null,"errorMessage":null,"references":[]}}

result.values:
{"Critical Update Instruction Flow./start.message":{"@class":"InVal","@id":"b3b7d62a-931e-416b-bebe-fa5ec5e2130f","value":"
  • Navigate to All > Instance Scan > Suites.
  • In the Suites list, select Deprecated APIs
  • In the Suites record, select GlideEncrypter from the Child Suites related list.
    • In the Suite record, select Execute Suite Scan to run the scan.
      • During the scan execution a Execute Suite Scan window displays the progress of the scan.
      • Note: This scan checks only records that have been created or modified by the customer.  ServiceNow  handled removal of GlideEncrypter usages for any records created by ServiceNow.
  • When the scan is complete, select Go to Result to view the Scan Result record.
    • In the Scan Result record, the Scan Findings list displays a list of records on your instance that are using the GlideEncrypter API.
  • Select the Count field on the Scan Findings list to navigate to a record.
  • Modify any scripts in the record that uses the GlideEncrypter API.
    • For details on alternatives to GlideEncrypter, see Alternatives to deprecated GlideEncrypter APIs.
  • After removing GlideEncrypter calls from your scripts, run the scan again to ensure that there are no remaining calls to the API.
","displayValue":"
  • Navigate to All > Instance Scan > Suites.
  • In the Suites list, select Deprecated APIs
  • In the Suites record, select GlideEncrypter from the Child Suites related list.
    • In the Suite record, select Execute Suite Scan to run the scan.
      • During the scan execution a Execute Suite Scan window displays the progress of the scan.
      • Note: This scan checks only records that have been created or modified by the customer.  ServiceNow  handled removal of GlideEncrypter usages for any records created by ServiceNow.
  • When the scan is complete, select Go to Result to view the Scan Result record.
    • In the Scan Result record, the Scan Findings list displays a list of records on your instance that are using the GlideEncrypter API.
  • Select the Count field on the Scan Findings list to navigate to a record.
  • Modify any scripts in the record that uses the GlideEncrypter API.
    • For details on alternatives to GlideEncrypter, see Alternatives to deprecated GlideEncrypter APIs.
  • After removing GlideEncrypter calls from your scripts, run the scan again to ensure that there are no remaining calls to the API.
","template":"","hasValue":true,"inputUsed":false,"simpleType":"OPAQUE","valTemplate":null,"errorMessage":null,"references":[]},"Critical Update Instruction Flow.4d584e80-3d15-45fe-b99e-e8e00a4bf6eb./end.record":{"@class":"InVal","@id":"4fa04de7-a352-424d-b640-b918b182c4d7","value":{"@class":"com.snc.process_flow.engine.serialization.GRProxy","table":"sys_flow_data","sys_id":["4909c48004866210559073c06a02f7e4"],"row":0,"sort":null,"desc":false},"displayValue":"4909c48004866210559073c06a02f7e4","template":"","hasValue":true,"inputUsed":false,"simpleType":"OPAQUE","valTemplate":null,"errorMessage":null,"references":[]}}

{"Critical Update Instruction Flow./start.message":{"@class":"InVal","@id":"0699c3cb-5430-4f9a-9585-17e22fbf07a5","value":"
  • Open User Login History
  • Search for each of the above identified users in the 'User' column.
  • If a user is present in the table, they are logging in through the UI.
  • Repeat this process for all users to determine if they are logging in through the UI or only using integrations.
    • ","displayValue":"
    • Open User Login History
    • Search for each of the above identified users in the 'User' column.
    • If a user is present in the table, they are logging in through the UI.
    • Repeat this process for all users to determine if they are logging in through the UI or only using integrations.

result.values:
{"Critical Update Instruction Flow./start.message":{"@class":"InVal","@id":"0c9ee5d7-acac-46bb-a32c-2bced92b8f92","value":"

Complete deprecation

Enabling complete deprecation removes the usage of 3DES for all the password2 fields in your instance. If all the considerations are met, then there are no configuration or scenarios where 3DES is used in password2 fields.

Partial deprecation

Enabling partial deprecation removes the usage of 3DES for all the password2 fields except legacy configured fields. Legacy configuration password2 fields continue to use 3DES encryption. Select this option only when you must continue to use 3DES for legacy configured fields.

","displayValue":"

Complete deprecation

Enabling complete deprecation removes the usage of 3DES for all the password2 fields in your instance. If all the considerations are met, then there are no configuration or scenarios where 3DES is used in password2 fields.

Partial deprecation

Enabling partial deprecation removes the usage of 3DES for all the password2 fields except legacy configured fields. Legacy configuration password2 fields continue to use 3DES encryption. Select this option only when you must continue to use 3DES for legacy configured fields.

","template":"","hasValue":true,"inputUsed":false,"simpleType":"OPAQUE","valTemplate":null,"errorMessage":null,"references":[]},"Critical Update Instruction Flow.4d584e80-3d15-45fe-b99e-e8e00a4bf6eb./end.record":{"@class":"InVal","@id":"87b5fee0-1fc7-400a-8093-a7333eb23c05","value":{"@class":"com.snc.process_flow.engine.serialization.GRProxy","table":"sys_flow_data","sys_id":["b009848004866210559073c06a02f7e0"],"row":0,"sort":null,"desc":false},"displayValue":"b009848004866210559073c06a02f7e0","template":"","hasValue":true,"inputUsed":false,"simpleType":"OPAQUE","valTemplate":null,"errorMessage":null,"references":[]}}

result.values:
{"Critical Update Instruction Flow./start.message":{"@class":"InVal","@id":"b7fa5e99-6f0d-4028-ad4f-58705b1e8e28","value":"
  1. Validate all functionality where password2 encrypted texts are shared between two ServiceNow instances.
    1. For example, if encrypted data is going to a different instance, first use KMF Resource Exchange to send that key to the other instance.  This way, when you run your functionality on the other instance that uses the encrypted text, the KMF key will be present.
  2. Validate use cases where Password2 input lengths greater than 125 characters.
    1. If you are downgrading an instance through clone
      1. If a customer enables 3DES deprecation on a Vancouver instance and they want to downgrade it to pre-Vancouver release versions through Instance Cloning, then they need to do some due diligence before initiating the clone.
      2. Review the steps for pre-cloning discussed in Request 3DES deprecation for password2 fields
      3. Failing to do so can lead to decryption failures for inputs of length > 125 in password2 fields in pre-Vancouver downgraded instances.
    2. If you are transferring password2 data to lower version instances
      1. Customers having use cases to transfer password2 encrypted texts > 125 characters should ensure that the instances where such data is transferred is on Vancouver or higher releases with KMF resource exchange enabled. Instances on pre-Vancouver release versions don’t support decryption of such password2 data.
","displayValue":"
  1. Validate all functionality where password2 encrypted texts are shared between two ServiceNow instances.
    1. For example, if encrypted data is going to a different instance, first use KMF Resource Exchange to send that key to the other instance.  This way, when you run your functionality on the other instance that uses the encrypted text, the KMF key will be present.
  2. Validate use cases where Password2 input lengths greater than 125 characters.
    1. If you are downgrading an instance through clone
      1. If a customer enables 3DES deprecation on a Vancouver instance and they want to downgrade it to pre-Vancouver release versions through Instance Cloning, then they need to do some due diligence before initiating the clone.
      2. Review the steps for pre-cloning discussed in Request 3DES deprecation for password2 fields
      3. Failing to do so can lead to decryption failures for inputs of length > 125 in password2 fields in pre-Vancouver downgraded instances.
    2. If you are transferring password2 data to lower version instances
      1. Customers having use cases to transfer password2 encrypted texts > 125 characters should ensure that the instances where such data is transferred is on Vancouver or higher releases with KMF resource exchange enabled. Instances on pre-Vancouver release versions don’t support decryption of such password2 data.
","template":"","hasValue":true,"inputUsed":false,"simpleType":"OPAQUE","valTemplate":null,"errorMessage":null,"references":[]},"Critical Update Instruction Flow.4d584e80-3d15-45fe-b99e-e8e00a4bf6eb./end.record":{"@class":"InVal","@id":"c77b1627-1335-4c81-b885-b9bc7830e68e","value":{"@class":"com.snc.process_flow.engine.serialization.GRProxy","table":"sys_flow_data","sys_id":["a409848004866210559073c06a02f7ba"],"row":0,"sort":null,"desc":false},"displayValue":"a409848004866210559073c06a02f7ba","template":"","hasValue":true,"inputUsed":false,"simpleType":"OPAQUE","valTemplate":null,"errorMessage":null,"references":[]}}
